snippet: Peter L. Zimroth, 70, a lawyer who was the city’s chief counsel under the Koch administration, said he was “honored” to be chosen by the judge in the federal stop-and-frisk case.
abstract: Man in the News profile of Peter Lenard Zimroth, lawyer who is taking on role of court-appointed monitor of New York City Police; difficult task ahead for Zimroth involves ensuring city's stop-and-frisk policy adheres to Supreme court decision in case of Floyd vs City of New York.
lead_paragraph: Peter L. Zimroth, 70, a lawyer who was the city’s chief counsel under the Koch administration, said he was “honored” to be chosen by the judge in the federal stop-and-frisk case.

headline.main: Court-Appointed Police Monitor Has Fought for City and Against It
headline.print_headline: Court-Appointed Police Monitor Has Fought for City and Against It
